Law: Resolution 338/2014 by National Civil Aviation Agency - Slots allocation
Text: Slot allocation process is primarily based on historic precedence: historic slots, comprising a series of slots allocated to an air carrier at the previous equivalent season, which entitles the firm to claim its allocation within the same coordination parameter in the next equivalent season, as long as the airline complies with the minimum regular operation (not less than 80%) and the maximum tolerated delay of arrival or departure (not less than 15 minutes).

Law: Resolution 338/2014 by National Civil Aviation Agency - Slots allocation
Text: The lot distribution process is based mainly on historical priority: historical slots, consisting of a series of slots assigned to the carrier in the previous equivalent season, which gives the firm the right to claim its distribution within the same coordination parameter in the next equivalent season, provided that the airline meets the minimum requirements for regular operations (at least 80 per cent) and the maximum permissible delay on arrival or departure (at least 15 minutes).

Law: Resolution 338/2014 by National Civil Aviation Agency - Slots allocation
Text: The allocation of slots is primarily based on historical priority: historical slots, consisting of a number of slots allocated to an air carrier in the previous equivalent season, which entitle the company to use its allocation within the same coordination parameter in the next equivalent season, as long as the airline meets the minimum regular operation (at least 80%) and the maximum acceptable delay on arrival or departure (at least 15 minutes).

Law: Resolution 338/2014 by National Civil Aviation Agency - Slots allocation
Text: The slot allocation process is based mainly on historical precedence: historical slots, comprising a series of slots allocated to an airline in the previous equivalent season, which entitles the company to claim its assignment within the same coordination parameter in the next equivalent season, provided that the airline complies with the minimum regular operation (not less than 80%) and the maximum tolerated delay of arrival or departure (not less than 15 minutes).

Law: Resolution 338/2014 by National Civil Aviation Agency - Slots allocation
Text: The Slot allocation process is based mainly on historical priority: historical slots involving a series of slots allocated to an air carrier during the previous equivalent season, which gives the company the right to request its allocation within the same coordination in the next equivalent season, provided that the airline complies with the minimum regular operation (not less than 80%) and the maximum arrival or departure delay (not less than 15 minutes).

Law: Resolution 338/2014 by National Civil Aviation Agency - Slots allocation
Text: The allocation of space is based primarily on historical precedence: time periods, consisting of a series of openings allocated to an airline in the previous equivalent season, which gives the airline the right to claim allocation within the same coordination parameters for the next equivalent season, as long as the airline complies with the minimum normal operating limit (at least 80 per cent) and the maximum permitted late arrival or departure limit (at least 15 minutes).

Law: Notice of Auction 1/2016 (fourth round of airport concession)
Text: The bidder (or one member of a consortium) must prove a 5-year experience as airport operator having handled at least (i) 9 million passengers at least 1 year in the last 5 years (SSA and POA); (ii) 7 million passengers at least 1 year in the last 5 years (FOR); or (iii) 4 million passengers at least 1 year in the last 5 years (FLN). The airport operator must hold at least 15% stake in the consortium.

Law: Regulation (RBAC) 141/2019 by National Civil Aviation Agency – Civil aviation schools
Text: A civil aviation instruction centre (CIAC) may give practical tests for obtaining and revalidating licences, qualifications and certificates (for pilots, flight mechanics, flight attendants, flight dispatchers and aircraft maintenance technicians), as long as it holds an authorisation by ANAC.

Law: Law 7565/1986 - Brazilian Aeronautical Code

Law: Law 14133/2021 - New General Procurement Act
Text: To obtain the technical-professional and the technical-operational qualification, the company may be required to present, among other documents: (i) a declaration of technical liability to equivalent works or services, issued by a professional registered with the respective professional association, when applicable (item I); (ii) certificates issued by the respective  professional association, when applicable, demonstrating operational capacity in the execution of similar services (item II).

Law: Decree 92319/1986 - Foreign air transport companies
Text: Foreign air transport companies, providing either scheduled or non-scheduled services, must obtain prior authorisation from the Federal Government to operate in Brazil. They must have been designated [by the foreign government] in the form of bilateral agreements or, in the absence of these agreements, there must be an interest in obtaining the authorisation unilaterally.

Law: Decree 92319/1986 - Foreign air transport companies
Text: Any foreign air carrier providing regular or non-scheduled services must be authorised in advance by the Federal Government to operate in Brazil. They must have been designated [by the foreign government] in the form of bilateral agreements or, in the absence of such agreements, there must be an interest in obtaining the licence unilaterally.

Law: Decree 92319/1986 - Foreign air transport companies
Text: Foreign air carriers, which provide scheduled or unscheduled services, must obtain prior authorization from the Federal Government to operate in Brazil, and must have been identified [by the foreign Government] in the form of bilateral agreements, or in the absence of such agreements, there must be an interest in obtaining unilateral authorization.

Law: Decree 92319/1986 - Foreign air transport companies
Text: A foreign air transport company providing scheduled or unplanned services must obtain prior authorisation from the Federal Government to operate in Brazil. It must be identified by [the foreign government] in the form of bilateral agreements or, in the absence of such agreements, there must be an interest in obtaining authorisation unilaterally.

Law: Decree 92319/1986 - Foreign air transport companies
Text: Foreign air carriers, which provide regular or non-regular services, must obtain prior authorization from the Federal Government to operate in Brazil. They must have been designated [by the foreign government] in the form of bilateral agreements or, in the absence of such agreements, there must be an interest in obtaining authorization unilaterally.

Law: Adenda al Convenio de Concertación
Text: A 1996 agreement between the Ministry of Economy and CANIFARMA (amended in 2004) establishes maximum retail prices for patented medicines. In Mexico, this is calculated as the average ex- manufacturer price of that medicine in the six countries with the largest sales in the world.

Text: A 1996 agreement between the Ministry of Economic Affairs and CANIMARMA (amended in 2004) sets the maximum retail price for patented medicinal products, which is calculated in Mexico as the average price before the manufacturer of the medicinal product in the six countries with the highest worldwide sales.
